text: A cute little nautical themed pub. Its a bit cranped for space but the atmosphere is friendly and easy going. There's a free pool table which is always fun! Drinks are pretty expensive but that's probably just Singapore in general

Orderd 3 fish and chips and an english breakfast.. First 2 sets of Fish and chips the fried fish was super thin and overfried.. Fries were mainly overfried and hard.. Fish tastes bland.. In addition, the fried fish was small.. English breakfast was bad too.. First time seeing the insides of the Hashbrowns is blackish.. Can see the photos.. English breakfast taste was very meh too.. For these prices, greatly overpriced..

We had mixed feelings about Jolly Roger. The place gave us a warm welcome, but we noticed that many items on the menu were not available that day. We're not sure if it was because of the time of day or if the chef was absent. We ordered a few items, and the food was okay, but the options were quite limited. The drinks were reasonably priced compared to other bistros. Despite that, the environment was good, and we enjoyed meeting new people and chatting. I'm not sure if I would come back unless they upgrade the menu and offer more food options. If they do, then maybe I would consider returning.

A hidden jem. Who would have thought there is a place lie this in a residential estate.

The ambience is fantastic and gives a very good vibe, homely atmosphere and a touch of English.

The food is good. We ordered the butter chicken with naan which is delicious and tast and Jolly Roger Burger which is also tasty as well but the source a bit salty to my liking.

Was served by Xiao Ling who is very polite and helpful.
Been craving sunday roast for the longest time and a friend recommended this place. Craving satisfied. Food is great, washed down with a pint of Guinness.
